website_summaries.verdict: Binoculars that will fit comfortably into your pocket and your budget.
cons: Some have said it's a little difficult to focus the binoculars for a crisp, clear view

customer_reviews.title: ... my wife to bring to ballet/broadway/theatre performances to get better views when our seats are in the next county
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife to bring to ballet/broadway/theatre performances to get better views when our seats are in the next county. (Because one pair of binoculars is cheaper than Orchestra tickets to the next five shows.) So far, so good--still married, still going to shows, still sitting in the nosebleeds with enough money for the train home afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to fit in pocket & powerful & clear
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 12x25 & it is very nice! Small & powerful! I like that it has an attached neck strap, even if it is just a thin cord. It also comes with a canvas carrying case, with a velcro closure. I've been using it to view backyard birds & it is great for that & the adjustable focus works well. I could make out a car's license plate number from over 100yards away. I think these would also be excellent for concerts & sporting events. Next time I will go, I will take with & update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Cats Cuddles

customer_reviews.title: Tried 4 pairs before giving up
customer_reviews.text: These are all junk. I bought and returned 4 pair of these before I realized that I would never be sent one that isn't flawed in some way. First one had a crack in a lens. Second one had a loose and inop focus wheel. Third one would not focus both eyes. Fourth pair had so much water spots and debris inside them that the image looked like it was dusk or dawn when it was noon and bright and sunny outside. DO NOT BUY THESE EXPECTING ANYTHING BUT JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look cool too.
customer_reviews.text: (8x21) Very compact and lightweight. Just what I wanted. Solid construction. Tight and smooth hinges and focus roller. Rubbery grip. Look cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Crr

customer_reviews.title: and 8x was great. At 12x it was hard to focus and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for awhile now and still use them for bird watching and airshows. I originally bought this 12x for the opera and I also got the 8x for my wife. 12x is just too much for the opera, and 8x was great. At 12x it was hard to focus and this did not pull enough light so everything was dark. During the day it works great but then you still have shaking issues. I think at 12x you really need to start looking at binoculars with image stabilizers. All in all this product is solid, can take drops, and does its purpose. My only issue is that it is very hard to focus.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie B.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great so far
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are spectacular for $14. I bought the 10x25 magnification and they came fast and in great quality! I opened them immediately to try them out! They come with a nice case for them and they focus in so good. The only down part is that both eyes pieces dont adjust. You should be able to move those so if you have glasses you can move the eye piece to make it easier. But for $14 they are a great deal! I haven't done much with them yet but im going camping in AZ for 2 months so I will repost afterwards so you guys know how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!. I got these for viewing an airshow ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!. I got these for viewing an airshow and they were great. It was easy to locate and track the aircraft and the 12x magnification was perfect. I was able to pick out details on the planes in flight and acquire the Thunderbirds when they were doing their turn about 5 miles away as they turned against the back drop of the mountains east of the air base. They have also been great picking out features in town and on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: ev

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to use, great price
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our young boys (3&5). I have used them for looking across the field (1/8-1/4 mile) and I was able to easily focus them. My three year old can't use them well right now but he enjoys being like his brother. My 5 year old is learning how to look through them but it's best if I focus them and then he looks. Great product for the price and they're fairly durable. Lasted two months so far with my rough boys!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Utterly useless!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this binocular (12x25) to spot range targets at 100 yds, but ended up doing a lot of running back and forth instead. The glass is extra foggy and you can only really focus out to about 25 yds or so. The image that the glass provides is so unclear that I couldn't spot my shots on a splatter target from 10 yds away, let alone 100. Save yourself from having to return this item and just don't buy it in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: SomeRandomDude

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the money. Good for "glassing" the landscape at about 200-300 years. They really do the job. While looking for bigger animals, I was actually amazed to observe an insect (a moth, etc.) hovering over grasses some 150 yards away. I have used them a whole day out in 24F (-4C) weather. This (10x32) is my second Bushnell Powerview Compact binoculars, previous (10x25) I have lost. I would recommend getting the 10x32 model as you get much better visibility at almost the same price and package size. I know there are binoculars for 100 times more (in $2,000 range Leica/Swarovski/Zeiss), but I cannot justify it on my budget.
customer_reviews.author: Uki Dominque Lucas

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you want a sharp, crisp image that is bright and in-focus, don't get these binoculars. They're $40, and their quality is about $40 worth of quality. If you're looking for a cheap pair of binoculars with decent magnification (albeit slightly out-of-focus, no matter how hard you try), these are fine. Light, easy to toss in a backpack, and I'm not worried about dropping them or banging them up.
customer_reviews.author: Lumberjack Laika

customer_reviews.title: Another case of "you get what you pay for"
customer_reviews.text: These are basically pretty crappy binoculars, regardless of what the other reviews say. The contrast is low, the collimation is marginal, and the color rendition is poor. They will not be durable. This is about what you expect of binoculars at this price point; in short, if you buy these, keep your expectations low. They are OK for reading the numbers on football jerseys on a bright afternoon. They are not OK for looking at wildlife, stars, scenery, or anything in a low-light or high-glare environment.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Science

customer_reviews.title: Light and small, worth carrying around
customer_reviews.text: We took this to the opera and it was perfect. Just the right magnification to see facial expressions without getting sick from not being able to hold it still enough. This folds up to fit in your hand, so it was easy to hide in my small purse. I will definitely be taking this with me hiking. I usually go without on outdoor trips because I minimize weight, but these are so light and small, that I would consider them worth carrying around. A steal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie F.

customer_reviews.title: money well spent
customer_reviews.text: for the price it fits in a bag easy and case is nice. case fits on a belt and everything is very tidy and easy to use. Case you could put thick wallet in or a 50% thicker deck of cards if you need size reference. focus is simple and only tried it out a bit spying at what blue lights are for down the street but works fine for extending your sight. will be taking to the woods with it soon for help scouting animals or the range to spot pistol shots maybe. I'm very happy being it's very compact and not much money.
customer_reviews.author: fekkai

customer_reviews.title: work just fine.
customer_reviews.text: bought the 8X21s to use at a concert where I was about 200ft from the stage. Didn't REALLY need them at that distance but wanted to see detail in the faces of the performers. Worked very well for that purpose, will likely use them for a better look at wildlife too. I find the image to be good to my inexperienced eye. Focusing was not difficult. The diopter is pretty easy to accidentally move out of position, but there if a reference marker so its easy to quickly readjust if you know about it.
customer_reviews.author: BuyStuff A.

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I've had these binoculars for a week. Love them so far. Excellent value for the price. I like how sturdy they feel. Small enough to carry around wherever. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: This seems to be a fine, durable set of binoculars for young explorers who ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a fine, durable set of binoculars for young explorers who do not need a heavy, high mag. product yet, but can begin to learn use & function as well as the pleasure of having a sturdy pair of binoculars that look decent for big kids (8-10) yet are not tremendously costly. Come with a small case too. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza-Susan Dabbs-Hampton

customer_reviews.title: but should be great for a concert or sporting event
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for a friend who wanted some small binoculars to use at concerts and plays. These exceeded my expectations. If anything, I think they may zoom more than necessary in a theater, but should be great for a concert or sporting event. I am planning to buy a pair for myself in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AWamazonreviews

customer_reviews.title: these are excellent binoculars. These are amazingly compact and portable
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, these are excellent binoculars. These are amazingly compact and portable, and you could easily fit them in a coat pocket without issue. Unfortunately for my needs, I really want something larger. After trying these, I find that I don't really need the portability as much as I do the stability and comfort of a larger design. Please don't let my personal choice sway you from purchasing these fine binoculars!
customer_reviews.author: J. Barr

customer_reviews.title: Not worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for sitting on a window sill to help my family see across our pasture. These are not made for outdoor use, their light construction would preclude much other than my intended use. But, they broke anyway. While adjusting the eye piece it came off in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Tebay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a concert or show.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take with me to go see a concert. They were perfect. Fit in purse. Not too bulky. Enough of a magnification that I could see on stage and bright enough to see in the dark theater. I just had them out the other night was looking at the moon -high enough quality that you can see the craters and color variations in the moon. Nice case. The string on them is a bit thin to wear them around your neck, it cuts in a little bit. But overall, very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Really like these. I was looking for a small pair of binoculars to bring to concerts and take on hikes. I bought another less expensive brand and they broke in the first week. So I returned them and spent $5 more for these. I really like them. Rugged enough to carry around. Case is good to attached to my belt on hikes. Easy to focus and enjoy. It's been really great at concerts.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch T

customer_reviews.title: Amazing View
customer_reviews.text: I think that I ordered these binoculars on a Wednesday and they arrived on a Saturday. I have been very impressed with how great they work and how clear the view is. I have been using them to spot shots on my target from a high power pellet gun. I have my paper targets set out about 50 yards and can typically see my shots without a problem. It has been a great help when spotting in my new scope.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and burden free!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 10x25 & it is adorable! It's appropriately small so it not a burden when you are out trekking or sightseeing. I tried it out locally and was able to read license feet from far away. Sorry, I am not too good at estimating how far something is! And it is a Bushnell, and it comes with the excellent build quality they stand for. It's easy to hold as well. For $12 it's much better than you'd expect.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: These rock - don't let the price fool you
customer_reviews.text: These binos are perfect for concerts, even outdoors going from day to night. After researching for this type of use, I bought the 8x21 and couldn't be any happier. Visibility is great and they're easy to focus. These even compare to my expensive Nikon's, except they're super portable. The reviews for this product (at $14 when I bought them) were about the same as those for binoculars that cost 3-4x more, so don't be fooled by price.
customer_reviews.author: LaRose

customer_reviews.title: Great for siting at the gun range
customer_reviews.text: For use at the gun range at 50 ft. Easy to focus, doesn't take up much room on the lane countertop. Sure beats having to pulley the target sheet back and forth then needing to wait for it to settle. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina S.

customer_reviews.title: I'm am amateur birdwatcher and I really liked these binoculars I bought for a vacation
customer_reviews.text: I'm am amateur birdwatcher and I really liked these binoculars I bought for a vacation. Considering the fantastic price, these helped me a lot in spotting birds and wildlife. You aren't going to get the great range you get with larger, more expensive, higher quality binoculars, but price and compactness were important to me. These aren't too tiny, but they are very compact and great for general travel. Happy I have these and would recommend them, they will be great until I get more serious and upgrade to a larger lens.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Parallax problem
customer_reviews.text: These are handy and the image is quite good except that the two side do not collimate causing a double image. I have two pair and they both have the same problem. This seems to be a generic problem with miniature binos that have a double hinge. I can twist them into alignment, but an adjustment. or better QC would be the solution
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth S. Obenski

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell always delivers. Although this is not a high ...
customer_reviews.text: Bushnell always delivers. Although this is not a high tech optic, I can see things clear as day between 50-150 yards. After 200 yards things begin to get a little bit blurry but you cant ask for more out of an 8x21.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the selling price. Great for the kids.
customer_reviews.text: Great item for the kids to play with watching birds and such. I bought them due to price to use in my deer stand. I got what I paid for. Couldn't get them to focus easily and they fogged up in the cool morning air. Good value for the price but just not suited for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph C Jones Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good for what they are...
customer_reviews.text: So don't expect a high dollar performance from these bino's, they are what they are. I keep mine in my archery side quiver for range shooting and they work pretty good. Like I said, you cannot compare them to more expensive full size bino's, but they are a decent compact binocular for the price. I expected as much and no regrets on purchasing them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality lenses, very unclear/bad focusing
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to complain for under $20 but the quality is extremely lacking... I ordered 2 to compare, the 8x21 and 12x24 and both lenses are like looking out of a dirty foggy window. Very unclear focusing anything past 50ft, it actually becomes nauseating to look through for more than 10 seconds. No joke, I still have a headache while writing this right now from using them and that was 30 min ago. It’s great that they’re compact but if you are doing any serious spectating these are not for you. For kids maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stable Image, Super Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I love these binoculars. I sit with my morning coffee and bird watch. These are super lightweight. 4 inches wide by 3 1/2 inches long. Super compact. You can carry them anywhere. A thin string is attached, for lightweight wear around neck. (dangerous for kids). The dial is well made and easy to focus. There are no big eye placement holders -- just a soft rubber end, so it takes a while to find your eye placement, not a big problem. They focus easily and are not jittery at all, you get a very stable image. I am super happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Lanzillotto author of L is for Lion

customer_reviews.title: Good value, great for events and live performance.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these because there was a rebate. They are compact, simple to use. They feel solid and well built. The image quality is good for the price point. The knob and pivots feel snug. Great for sporting events and live shows. The outside rubber gives a little so it has good holding power. Comes in a pouch which can be secured on your belt. Fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tickles

customer_reviews.title: I was tempted to give this four stars for going ...
customer_reviews.text: I was tempted to give this four stars for going on sale just after I bought it, but that's not a helpful review. I bought these for my 6th grader and I to use when we go on nature walks. At the price and quality, they are not a toy, but are cheap enough that I don't worry about them getting lost or broken. We have more expensive binoculars, but I didn't want to have to worry about those. We were able to successfully look at many birds along our trip, and he was able to use them without my assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Emmie

customer_reviews.title: Junk - Get what you pay for I suppose
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 10x32 with hopes they would be sufficient for hiking and bird watching. These were junk. I ended up using only the right lense as they would not get a clear image using both lenses - perhaps the left had a manufacturing problem. It wasn't worth me carrying these home from Seattle (bag already full) to return them so I donated them to a local nature center - hopefully they can use them. This pair took forever to focus and it was nearly impossible to get a clear image unless you only used the right lense.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyLikesIt

customer_reviews.title: Pluck Out Your Eyelashes & Experience Life Up Close
customer_reviews.text: These have a shallow eye well, and my eyelashes hit the glass. I do not have particularly long eyelashes. The space is only 1/4 deep. In order to use these, I would have to hold them perfectly steadily and very close to, but not touching my face.
customer_reviews.author: C.O.S.

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad my wife thought it was a good idea to ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Bought these for a cruise to Alaska this past summer. I'm so glad my wife thought it was a good idea to order some for the trip. I could not be happier with them. I bought the Bushnell 8x21 and 10x25. My daughters carried the 8x21 and they were easy for them to spot and focus with. The 10x25 are a little more difficult to use because the higher magnification makes it harder to keep still. But they were perfect for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase - Horrible
customer_reviews.text: We returned this item - it was horrible. You could not quickly get it focused - nor would it stay focused. We have two very old and heavy Bushnell viewers that we've used for years and wished we'd taken them to Alaska with us. They folded nicely and were light weight and that's about the only good thing I have to say.
customer_reviews.author: Joyful 🐱

customer_reviews.title: These are great, I bought them for the opera and they ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great, I bought them for the opera and they worked well, small enough to carry in your purse but powerful enough to see the stage. I would say we were probably 300 ft away in the balcony and they worked very well. I have used them in my backyard for birdwatching and they worked just as well as some large binoculars I have.
customer_reviews.author: SFjax

customer_reviews.title: Great little binoculars for taking to a concert
customer_reviews.text: Great little binoculars for taking to a concert. ****I was NOT provided this item for free or at a discounted price. I just like to buy things and try to help the next consumer by writing up my experience****
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pair of Binos
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for bird watching and traveling in Costa Rica. They did a great job for me. Could see the sloths high up in the trees really well! Easy to carry, easy to use. Glad I bought them. Now using them to bird watch in my area--right from my deck.
customer_reviews.author: C. Leger

customer_reviews.title: Defective or just not good....
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I received a defective product, but these are blurry as possible. I have tried to use them twice since I purchased them, and one lens is completely blurry no matter what I do. Very difficult, if not impossible to see out of. Its shame because they are the right size. If this is a known issue, I would appreciate replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Vision and clarity are amazing in these little binoculars.  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 8x21 binoculars for my daughter for a concert which was nearly sold out except for upper balcony seats. The view and distance in these little folding binoculars are amazing and they fold up to fit inside your purse. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie

customer_reviews.title: Lots of color fringing
customer_reviews.text: For the price, should definitely not expect high fidelity. Lots of color fringing/chromatic aberrations, even when compared to my old pair of Nippon Kogaku from the 1950s. Good for traveling in high theft area, or give to someone who constantly wants to borrow yours on a trip.
customer_reviews.author: D. leung

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. My sister hikes a lot, so I got it so she could just see something in the distance .. you know, when you see something and say ... What the heck is that! Its light weight for hiking. Good deal for the money. Came quickly, good service.
customer_reviews.author: LibertyBelle

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the road
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price (I got them free). If you're looking for crisp, clear binoculars, keep looking. These are good enough for football games or backyard birding. If I was paying for them, I would spend the extra money for a better quality pair of binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my for my 8 year old nephew who is in cub scouts. My brother just took his boys on a short 2 day road trip through the Nebraska panhandle to see Chimney Rock, then up through Wyoming and then to Mt Rushmore. He said my nephew didn't take them off the whole trip. For a small cheap pair of Bushnell binoculars they are very clear and fit him perfect. He absolutely loves them. They would also make a great pf pocket binocs for anybody. I don't usually highly recommend something but these are great.
customer_reviews.author: ozman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product and great service!!!
customer_reviews.text: I started off reading the "Verified Reviews" only. After reading what a great product these small (great for car or purse) binoculars were, I ordered the fist pair, that unfortunately had a defect on the Lense. But, as to be expected, not every product made can turn out perfectly. I sent my a message explaining why the return, and the very next day a PERFECT pair arrived wrapped in a small box secured by another cardboard box with padding. For the amazing price, the range is exceptional. I'm extremely satisfied and will order again. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: March

customer_reviews.title: ... use them during the roadtrip and the have a pretty long view
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use them during the roadtrip and the have a pretty long view. The material on this thing are amazingly durable. I loved how tough it is and the little weight that it has for it's size. It definetly feels like a premium product. I totally recomend them if you're just going to travel and enjoy a couple of birds around yourself. I do not recomend them for heavy duty miles of field of view because the view it isn't that far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Merchan

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Alaska cruise.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my Alaska cruise. They are small and light enough to fit in my tiny cross body bag, and strong enough to see everything I wanted to see.
customer_reviews.author: Pink amazon

customer_reviews.title: Don't Do It.  Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: These suck. I only bought because they were $15 with a $15 MIR thus free. No matter how I adjust they're always a bit blurry. Not much magnification either. The wasted time I spent mailing in the rebate are worth more than the binocs themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: compact
customer_reviews.text: Love these little binoculars, Compact, easy to carry and, definitely improves the sight over distance. Granted they are not as powerful as the larger ones are, but they are light, easily adjustable and work for what we need them for.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R

customer_reviews.title: compact and light
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this purchase. I did look at the measurements ahead of time but they were such a great size for my purpose. I had been looking for a great set of binoculars that would be compact and light weight for spotting walking dead celebrities at their filming site. This was perfect. They are very light, definitely compact, and had more than ample zoom ability to identify the actors from behind our caution tape :) The only thing that I might have done differently was to have purchased a pair with camera capabilities. This way I could take pictures once I spotted the actor. This is next on my list for my next trip to Senoia, GA.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: A pleasant surprise...
customer_reviews.text: These peepers aren't for spotting targets at great distance, just for a better look around my yard/woods at birds and wildlife, on a trail, hits on a target in shooting practice, that kind of entertainment. I'm well pleased with the view for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jane O

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and compact
customer_reviews.text: This compact binoculars is so convenient to carry and use anywhere. I wanted one that was lightweight but powerful and this is the ticket. Folds in and small enough for a purse or deep pocket. Add the affordable price and it’s a winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Worley

customer_reviews.title: Center focus wheel faulty.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 16X model. It has excessive play in the center focus wheel. The wheel turns ~1/2 inch before it engages. I returned it for another 16X and it did the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Caputo

customer_reviews.title: Good Binos, crap strap
customer_reviews.text: focus is clear and binos fit nicely into that medium category between "compact but no field of vision" and "good field, but bulky and heavy". I've used it to help me spot debris and read car numbers at race-tracks and it works great. my only issue is that the neck strap is thinner than a dress-shoelace and completely useless. I plan on cutting mine off or wrapping with extra cord to make something you could actually wear comfortably. As is, the strap would make a good garotte and that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: Would love to give this 5 stars. Binos arrived with the common problem of being out of alignment, so a few stars lost there. But, with the good price, I just fixed them myself. The thing that impresses me the most about these is the field of view is one third greater than the new Bushnell 10x50 binos that I bought at the same time. Also, the 8x is about right, the 10x are a bit jittery. Very convenient to use, just pull out of the pouch, no lens caps to deal with. But the wide angle view puzzles me, since my other 10x50 is literally "Wide Angle" binos! Hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hiking and sightseeing
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these for a lighter alternative when I go hiking or camping. I could not be happier with the quality of Bushnell products. Highly recommend for the casual user or beginning hobbyist. You can get great looks at nature, Birds or any other wildlife you want to check out.
customer_reviews.author: xero gravity

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for hiking. I thought of not spending a lot of money, but in the end I had to buy a more expensive binocular. These are not bad optically. However, they are extremely cheaply build. Mine was broken on arrival. On first use, I was able to pull out one eyepiece which included one lens element. This was definitely not by design. It seems eyepiece thread was not there or broken. No force was needed to pull out the eyepiece. Amazon was good at handling the return, but I decided not to try my luck with another. I just bought Olympus Roamer 8x21. Three times the money, but I would say three times the build quality.
customer_reviews.author: satellite779

customer_reviews.title: You can't expect much for the price, but still not that impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting a lot considering these are only around $15. But still, I did expect better. Everything seems a bit foggy and out of focus. Not horrible, but just enough to be a nuisance. They're also not very comfortable on your eyes. I have a generic Chinese brand new pair that is more comfortable than these. While they are okay, I do think you could shop around and do better.
customer_reviews.author: Cabana on the Bay of E

customer_reviews.title: 8×21 is really good!
customer_reviews.text: It's small a perfect size for your packet, literally! The size of a tiny lighter. I didn't expected it to be nicely compact. It is well packaged and the image on theses binoculars are outstanding! It comes with a pouch and a small cleaning cloth. I am writing this review while using them right now. For those who have problems with the binoculars make sure to adjust the magnification outside because adjusting them indoors makes things to close up and blurry. (For those who know how to handle them Carry on)
customer_reviews.author: Evy

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: These are unbelievably great binoculars for less than $25! I have paid more than $500 for other binoculars but wanted an inexpensive pair that I wouldn't worry about losing or damaging. I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected. Wanted for school plays, concerts, and civic center events. Not the quality expected, either. Husband took them for the job site.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Optics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could see feather patterns in the birds that come to our bird feeders. These are perfect. Small but powerful. To me the optics are crystal clear and easy to focus. Feels solid in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: RadioRedman

customer_reviews.title: Fine, just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I really don't have anything to compare these to but for the price I am happy. The image is clear even long distance. I was about to read the airline name on planes 1000 or so feet away. There is ghosting around the image and using both eyes can slightly blur the image for me but for under 20$ these are great. Using for target sighting at gun range and they work just fine. Fine just fine.
customer_reviews.author: EuroVolk

customer_reviews.title: 8x21:  Small, decent travel binoculars
customer_reviews.text: The 8x21 binoculars are a nice compact size when folded. Image quality is good enough, and far, far better than the last $10 pair of binoculars I bought. I keep these in the car for when we travel for general use.
customer_reviews.author: CoastalGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good car binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband as a spare set of binoculars. It seems like whenever we go on a vacation he always sees something at a distance that he wishes he had binoculars to see better, and never has any, so these are our new pair to keep in the car. They aren't the most amazing binoculars in the world, but if you're sitting in the cheap seats at a sporting event, or see something in a field while you're out driving, or anything like that, these are great. They're nice and small, so they easily fit in a glove box or coat pocket, and they're pretty clear and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: abloom489

customer_reviews.title: Small, light and not expensive
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the 8x21mm model for an African safari my wife and I went on. They both worked really well as they were small, light and not expensive. Will probably now keep them in our cars.
customer_reviews.author: Perfect Black & Tan

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe how well these little beauties work for ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well these little beauties work for the money I spent. Bought them right before going to Europe and needed them as opera glasses. They were superb, for both my wife and I, with very different eyesight. Thank you Bushnell!
customer_reviews.author: Bill F.

customer_reviews.title: Good Field Glasses, Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: Great set of Field Glasses. Not too much to say here, they just work.Can see quite far easily with these Binoculars. I use these mostly for Camping/Hiking and sightseeing. Probably not as good compared to some 500 dollar glasses, but for my basic purposes they fit the bill. Seems durable, but I wont risk tossing them around like a football to find out. All in all, good purchase at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A+++
customer_reviews.text: A+++ we have had these now for many years. We keep them by our chairs in the sunroom to birdwatch. They really seem to be the best compromise for power and size. I have bought more powerful and more expensive ones only to find that they exceed our limit to handhold. A great value, decent build, and permitted at nearly all ticketed events.
customer_reviews.author: T Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars worked great. We took them on our trip to Yellowstone National Park and they helped us see nature and wildlife from a safe distance. They're not too heavy while also giving solid magnification.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: smudge on inner part of lens - can't clean it
customer_reviews.text: Looking through these binoculars there is a large smudge, so I used the included cloth to clean all the lenses. Turns out the smudge is actually ON THE INSIDE OF THE LENS. I would have to take this apart to clean it? Really annoyed honestly. I don't have the patience or experience to even want to try to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Robie

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars for shows or concerts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these binoculars to bring to Cirque du Soleil. The size was perfect, it fits in a small purse. They performed perfectly, We had mid priced seats but I was able to see the performers facial expressions as well as the custom's details. The binoculars allows for a lot of light to come in. I only used them for shows, I have a stronger binocular for wildlife watching. For concerts and shows these binoculars are perfect.mi highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Liliam

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: As with so many things, but specially as related to optics, you get what you pay for. These binoculares are inexpensive and deliver decent but no great views. The coatings, specially in the eyepieces are not enough and in daylight view the get a lot of white reflections sometimes compromising the quality and comfort of the viewing experience. They are well built though and surely have a long lifetime. Somehow focus seems to drift out of view although this is a minor problem really. All in all, I would recomend these binoculars if you are in a budget, but look higher up cost-wise if you really want a good quality view for birding or sports activities.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a present but we both use it on hikes. It is great for seeing birds very far away in the distance. The images are clear and it's easy to use the rotating knobs for focusing. It comes in a soft, thick casing that protects it. It also has a string that can be looped around your neck. The string is sort of thin, but very sturdy and durable. Wish it was a bit thicker or had padding for the neck area, but this would make it more bulkier. So if you are looking for a small and lightweight pair of binoculars in a compact protective case, this does the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Nice little binoculors
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a gift to a child and was surprised at how the quality is for the price. I am going to keep these and order another set for my grandson. What makes them especially useful to me is the size and portability. They come with a little case so they can be stuck in my bag. I like to look at birds and these serve my purpose just fine. The magnification and clarity met my expectations. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these very lightweight binoculars for one of my grandsons at the recommendation of one of his uncles who owns the same pair. My grandson wants to use them to look at birds and wildlife. They are powerful, but the nicest factor is that they are so lightweight when hanging around your neck. No one wants a dead weight! The case is very lightweight which is all that we wanted, so if you want something more substantial you might want to purchase a different case, for example an inexpensive camera case. The case doesn't detract enough from the quality of the binoculars to warrant a lower star level.
customer_reviews.author: Mikmity

customer_reviews.title: Image is "foggy"?
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to Yellowstone. The only word I can think to describe the image is foggy, especially in bright sunlight. I ended up using a pair of 8x21 Tasco cheapies that have a much clearer image than these. The 2x extra magnification doesn't do any good since the image is so bad. I don't know if mine are defective or if it is just the quality of the binocs. They are also much bigger than I expected, but still very compact. I will definitely be returning these. We'll call the 1 star rating for the compactness and look & feel of these.
customer_reviews.author: Cap'n

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cannot complain at all. I've gone through several cheap sets of compact binoculars and these are the first that are actually usable. The only con I can mention is the internal reflection under certain lighting conditions. It can be severe, but easy to eliminate by shifting position. Magnification is high enough to make a difference, but low enough to steady these light binoculars by hand. I use them at shows as they are discreet and keep them in my bag on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: arcanemotif

customer_reviews.title: Decent binoculars
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars will serve you well as long as you understand that they're cheapies. I use them for the gun range to take quick peeks downrange (I probably need glasses). For that purpose they work just right. But if you wanted them for something like birdwatching they might not be your best bet. If you're looking for something you can toss in a backpack or the glovebox in your car in case you need it, these are your binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Clear, Small, Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to carry around in my work van to inspect equipment up telephone and power poles and they're perfect for what I need especially at the price point. I would definitely buy them again for short to medium range work.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Small and acceptable
customer_reviews.text: Very small and easy to transport. I will probably keep these in my car or bag as an "emergency" pair. I have the 8x21 binocular. The image quality is suitable to just get a better peek at birds or a show. The biggest pro these have again is the very small size. I also purchased a 8x42 celestron outlander binocular that are a night and day difference to these. Bright clear images. They did cost around $60. You get what you pay for I guess, which makes me very curious about the $300+ binoculars
customer_reviews.author: A. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly compact and light weight
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for our 6 yr old grand daughter. She LOVES them!! They have great lenses and you can see very clear and far. My husband wants some for himself now. They are a great size for everyone
customer_reviews.author: Kim S. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: No shaking on these.
customer_reviews.text: I like these. They are perfect for counting horns on a buck from my porch. 8 x 21 doesn't shake like higher powered binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: R. Calloway

customer_reviews.title: Take to concerts, shows, national parks
customer_reviews.text: A nice set of binoculars for the price. It really only works in daylight, but you get what you pay for. Has a good magnification. Set your elbows on something solid to make a tripod for the most enjoyment. We looked all around the Grand Canyon on our trip last year. It was fun to see the next raft coming through the rapids. Things that were unrecognizable with the naked eye were huge in these binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving these binoculars two stars because the price is so low. It's hard to complain about 25 dollar binoculars, but I will anyway. The glass is very foggy. It feels like I'm looking through plastic toy binoculars. After spending 10 minutes with these, my eyes feel tired and strained. Also, the quality is so poor, that they won't stay focused. The dial that allows you to focus the right eye is very loose, and requires constant adjustment. Yes, they were cheap... but what is the point if you can hardly use them?
customer_reviews.author: jfrazier

customer_reviews.title: Wife likes them
customer_reviews.text: The neck strap is too narrow cuts into your neck and can’t be replaced due to the way it is manufactured. I have trouble with the focus can’t seem to get both side to clearly display.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Derbort

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price but grainy and a bit shaky....
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is amazing and does the trick but it is grainy after 100 yards and is a little shaky. Frankly with anything that is greater than 12x 32 I expected it to be shaky and grainy so I am not to disappointed. Nonetheless, there is a reason this one costs about $30 and the mid to high end ones cost $400 plus.... so given the price, its a great carry along for hikes. I have another powerview which is 7x and it is much clearer...albeit doesn't focus in as much. As I said, you get what you pay for and with this one you definitely even get a "Bit more" than you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: I returned this Bushnell compact binoculars for poor build quality. There were several inclusions (spots) inside one of the tubes or on the lens. They could be seen from the reversed view. The inside walls of the tubes which are slightly exposed on the far side lens are not completely painted. Though this item is inexpensive it doesn't take much to produce a better product., which may not increase the production costs - seems like they just don't care.
customer_reviews.author: ABE

customer_reviews.title: These are a great introductory pair of binoculars
customer_reviews.text: These are a great introductory pair of binoculars, but they are also great as a compact option. For the size, weight and price, they are hard to beat. After a few years and many excursions, I've experienced no problems with these whatsoever. These aren't going to be great for looking at small things at great distances, but they are so compact that I often bring them along even if I'm unsure whether or not I will actually use them.
customer_reviews.author: onlineoverinperson

customer_reviews.title: great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: light weight - 7 oz clear image - compared to my friend's same power binoculars, this one has clear and sharp images. compact, easy storage, and does not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: P. K. Yong

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these for concert viewing and I am hopeful they will do just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Prefer the look of this bronze-toned camouflage design vis-à-via the Brushnell black finish. Otherwise, the same comments apply--Nicely compact particularly when folded. Comes with a quality soft black fold over case. Versatile focus and sizing options, the range is quite variable. The 12x25 is more powerful than expected, not as suitable for looking across the street. However, I purchased these for concert viewing and I am hopeful they will do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: donna crawford hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for concert viewing
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for concert viewing! These are lightweight and fold into a compact carrying case that easily fits in cargo pants/shorts pockets. Great optics and fully adjustable just like my larger binoculars. I ordered these for a concert at Madison Square Garden where our seats weren't the best. With these, my wife and I were able to clearly watch the action on stage. I'd highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Lacks lens covers
customer_reviews.text: Annoying that it lacks lens covers. I want to set it on the table to pick up quickly, with the ocular covered to keep the dust off. Or in a jacket pocket. The carrying case is inconvenient for instant access.
customer_reviews.author: angry citizen

customer_reviews.title: Poor resolution at any distance
customer_reviews.text: Both my wife and I find these lack resolution. I had a similar cheap pair--identical specs and sizing--that I bought in an Army Navy store years ago that were much better. We are going to find something else.
customer_reviews.author: R. LaRue

customer_reviews.title: but she is getting better. I like that they are sturdy and come ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for our daughter who wanted her very own "spy kit" for Christmas. We decided to go ahead and purchase "real" binoculars for her so she could really use them in her kit. She has used them for playing, but also enjoys finding birds and animals in our yard as well. It is a little challenging for her to hold them steady, but she is getting better. I like that they are sturdy and come with their own carrying case. They fit her small hands well, and she will be able to keep them for years since they are not "toy" binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Hpg

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought something stronger than 8 x 21
customer_reviews.text: I have used the binoculars at a few concerts now. It worked very well at an indoor venue where I had pretty good seats. I could see Adam Levine perfectly! However, at a large music festival, it did not work well. I could hardly see the performer and it seemed to focus on people in the crowd rather than the performer. On the plus side, it is small and fits in my purse. I would say that the 8x21 would be good for concerts where you have really good seats and performances where it is a small venue (not a large music festival or if you are way in the back).
customer_reviews.author: philephan81

product_meta.title: Bushnell Powerview Compact Folding Roof Prism Binocular
product_meta.description:
TRAVELERS, NATURE OBSERVERS AND CONCERT GOERS LISTEN UP.

The PowerView series offers the largest line of Bushnell-quality, affordable binoculars. No matter what your purpose, you'll find a variety of magnifications, styles and sizes, and fully-coated optics for bright, vivid images. Bushnell PowerView compact binoculars combine contemporary styling and design with traditional Bushnell quality and durability. They are easy to use and economical and feature general-purpose roof prisms. Their black rubber armoring ensures they can sustain active use. Bushnell's PowerView compact binoculars include a carrying case and a neck strap for convenience and comfort on the go. 

Features:

 * Fully-coated optics for a brighter view
 * Non-slip rubber armor absorbs shock while providing a firm grip
 * Contemporary styling
 * Fold-down eyecups and center focus system
 * Lens Coating: Fully
 * Prism System: Roof
 * Prism Glass: BK-7
 * Not water/fog proof
 * Do not adapt to tripod



About Bushnell
Bushnell has been the industry leader in high-performance sports optics for more than 50 years. The company's guiding principle is to provide the highest quality, most reliable, and most affordable sports optics products on the market.



High powered magnification makes these pack-along binoculars popular for viewing wildlife.
feature_bullets: 10x magnification, 25-millimeter objective binoculars with roof prism system
BaK-7 prisms and multi-coated optics for superior resolution and image clarity
Rugged, shock-absorbing, non-slip rubber armor; center focus knob
Compact yet powerful binoculars suitable for a variety of applications

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
